intro: Fosbergia, commonly known as the Hawaiian flame flower, is a genus of flowering plants native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plants typically grow as shrubs or small trees, often reaching heights of up to 10 feet. Fosbergia species are known for their ability to thrive in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in coastal areas and dry forests. Their unique floral structure makes them an important part of Hawaii's native flora and a subject of botanical interest.
